{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2012}} {{Infobox earthquake | title = 2010 Pichilemu earthquake
''Terremoto de Pichilemu de 2010'' | date = {{Start date|2010|03|11|df=yes}} | origintime = 11:39:41 [[UTC-3]] | image = Structural damage after Pichilemu earthquake, as seen in April 2011.jpg | image alt = House damaged by the Pichilemu earthquake, in the epicentre town, as seen on 16 April 2011. | image name = | map2 = [[File:2010PichilemuShakeMapUSGS.png|210px]] | caption = Above: House damaged by the Pichilemu earthquake, in the epicentre town, as seen on 16 April 2011. Below: Pichilemu earthquake [[wikt:shakemap|shakemap]] produced by the [[United States Geological Survey]] | magnitude = 6.9 [[Moment magnitude scale|Mw]]
6.3 [[Richter magnitude scale|ML]] | intensity = [[Modified Mercalli intensity|MM]] X | depth = {{convert|33.1|km|mi|...}} | location = [[Pichilemu]], Chile
{{Coord|34.301|S|72.13|W|display =inline,title}} | countries affected = [[Chile]]
[[Argentina]] | tsunami = [[#Tsunami|Yes]] | casualties = 1 killed | PGA = 0.086''[[Peak ground acceleration|g]]'' ([[Curicó]], [[Maule Region|Maule]]){{cite web|url=http://earthquake.usgs.gov/earthquakes/shakemap/global/shake/2010tsa6/download/stationlist.txt |title=Station Lists |publisher=United States Geological Survey |year=2010 |accessdate=20 May 2012 |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/6EgfCbYQC?url=http%3A%2F%2Fearthquake.usgs.gov%2Fearthquakes%2Fshakemap%2Fglobal%2Fshake%2F2010tsa6%2Fdownload%2Fstationlist.txt |archivedate=25 February 2013 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} }} The '''2010 Pichilemu earthquake''' ({{lang-es|link=no|Terremoto de Pichilemu de 2010}}), also known as the '''Libertador O'Higgins earthquake''', was a 6.9 [[Moment magnitude scale|MW]] [[intraplate earthquake|intraplate]] [[earthquake]] that struck [[Chile]]'s [[O'Higgins Region]] on 11 March 2010. The earthquake was centred {{convert|15|km|mi|1}} northwest of the city of [[Pichilemu]], according to the [[University of Chile]] Seismological Service. The earthquake was caused by increased regional [[compression (geology)|stress]] arising from an [[2010 Chile earthquake|earthquake on 27 February]], centered offshore [[Maule Region]], which was felt throughout central Chile. The 11 March earthquake was at first thought to be an aftershock from the 27 February event, but University of Chile Seismologist Jaime Campos identified it as an "independent earthquake". The Hawaii-based [[Pacific Tsunami Warning Center]] pointed out the possibility of local tsunamis within {{convert|100|km|mi}} of the [[epicentre]], although small, but violent waves were seen in the Pichilemu and [[Bucalemu]] area. One person was reported dead. At least eleven aftershocks immediately followed, causing panic throughout coastal towns between the [[Coquimbo Region|Coquimbo]] and [[Los Lagos Region|Los Lagos]] regions. The earthquake was specially destructive in the epicentre town, [[Pichilemu]], capital of [[Cardenal Caro Province]]. The city hosts five National Monuments of Chile, of which two, the [[Agustín Ross Park]] and the [[Agustín Ross Cultural Centre]], were seriously damaged by the earthquake. It also damaged the villages of [[La Aguada, Pichilemu|La Aguada]] and [[Cardonal de Panilonco]]. [[Rancagua]], the capital of O'Higgins Region, was also damaged, leading President [[Sebastián Piñera]] to declare a catastrophe state in O'Higgins Region. ==Background== [[File:Plaza Arturo Prat y Quioscos Después.jpg|thumb|left|The city of [[Pichilemu]] was "devastated" by the [[2010 Chile earthquake|27 February 2010 earthquake and tsunami]].]] Nearly all of the territory of Chile is subject to earthquakes, arising from strains in the subducting Nazca and South American Plates or shallow [[strike-slip fault]]s. The subduction zone along the Chilean coast produced the most powerful earthquake ever recorded, the [[1960 Valdivia earthquake]].{{cite web|url=http://countrystudies.us/chile/36.htm|title=Chile - Geography|work=U.S. Library of the Congress|publisher=Country Studies US|accessdate=4 June 2012|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130122112252/http://countrystudies.us/chile/36.htm|archivedate=22 January 2013|deadurl=no}} Some earthquakes which occurred near the epicentre of the 11 March 2010 event are the 1985 [[1985 Algarrobo earthquake|Algarrobo]] and [[1985 Rapel Lake earthquake|Rapel Lake]] earthquakes.{{cite book|last1=Urrutia de Hazbún|first1=Rosa|last2=Lanza Lazcano|first2=Carlos|title=Catástrofes en Chile, 1541–1992|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=k64MAAAAYAAJ|year=1993|publisher=Editorial La Noria|location=[[Santiago de Chile]]|language=Spanish| accessdate= 13 September 2010 }} On 27 February 2010, a strong earthquake, which reached a magnitude of 8.8 on the [[moment magnitude scale]], hit central Chile. The earthquake occurred in the region of the plate boundary between the [[Nazca plate|Nazca]] and [[South American plate]]s, offshore Maule Region. The earthquake produced a tsunami which caused great damage in cities and towns along the Chilean coast;{{cite news|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/idUSTRE61Q0S920100227|title=Massive earthquake hits Chile, 214 dead|last=Saavedra|first=Jose Luis|date=27 February 2010|agency=Reuters|accessdate=17 October 2010|location=[[Concepción, Chile|Concepción]], Chile| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20101006112414/http://www.reuters.com/article/idUSTRE61Q0S920100227| archivedate= 6 October 2010 | deadurl= no}} Pichilemu was "devastated" after the earthquake and tsunami struck.{{cite news|url=http://www.elmorrocotudo.cl/admin/render/noticia/24777 |title=Terremoto y tsunami en Chile: Pichilemu devastado |last=Rebolledo |first=Víctor |date=28 February 2010 |work=El Morrocotudo |publisher=Inversiones y Publicaciones Comunidades Ciudadanas S. A. |language=Spanish |accessdate=4 June 2012 |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/6EgfoIVbN?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.elmorrocotudo.cl%2Fadmin%2Frender%2Fnoticia%2F24777 |archivedate=25 February 2013 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} The 6.9 earthquake of 11 March 2010 occurred two weeks after the 27 February event.{{cite news | title = New Chile quake as Pinera sworn in as president | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/8561340.stm |publisher=BBC News | date = 11 March 2010 | accessdate =2 September 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100902070458/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/8561340.stm| archivedate= 2 September 2010 | deadurl= no}} Chilean seismologists, including Sergio Barrientos from the University of Chile Seismological Service, were worried about the "absence of an earthquake around magnitude 7 following the February 27 quake."{{cite news|url=http://diario.elmercurio.com/2010/03/12/nacional/nacional/noticias/3394A796-6B3E-4073-9E0C-DC0C642887DC.htm?id={3394A796-6B3E-4073-9E0C-DC0C642887DC} |title=La réplica que llegó a 6,9 grados era una de las grandes que se esperaban y vendrán más |last=Bade |first=Gabriela |author2=Guzmán, Lorena |date=12 March 2012 |work=[[El Mercurio]] |publisher=[[COPESA]] |language=Spanish |accessdate=5 June 2012 |location=Vitacura, Chile |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/6EhzOt1YN?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdoc-0o-60-docs.googleusercontent.com%2Fdocs%2Fsecuresc%2Fha0ro937gcuc7l7deffksulhg5h7mbp1%2Fqgc02qo9tf7jp7avv1mm15eba4bjul6r%2F1361836800000%2F03878218933758081009%2F%2A%2F0B0avc7X-1skeWUV5ZG1QSXkzRDA%3Fe%3Ddownload |archivedate=25 February 2013 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }} {{subscription required}} Two foreshocks of the 11 March event occurred on 5 March: one reached magnitude 5.7, and the other magnitude 5.2; both were felt between the Valparaíso and Maule regions.{{cite news|url=http://www.emol.com/noticias/nacional/2010/03/05/401804/dos-sismos-sobre-5-grados-richter-sacudieron-la-zona-central.html |title=Dos sismos sobre 5 grados Richter sacudieron la zona central |date=5 March 2010 |work=[[El Mercurio]] (Online Version) |publisher=[[COPESA]] |language=Spanish |accessdate=5 June 2012 |location=Santiago, Chile |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/6Egfvn4bI?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.emol.com%2Fnoticias%2Fnacional%2F2010%2F03%2F05%2F401804%2Fdos-sismos-sobre-5-grados-richter-sacudieron-la-zona-central.html |archivedate=25 February 2013 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} ==Geology== The Pichilemu earthquake was caused by the change in regional [[compression (geology)|stress]] from the 27 February earthquake. Preliminary analyses by the [[United States Geological Survey]] (USGS) of the 11 March earthquake locations and seismic-wave radiation patterns suggested that the event resulted from normal faulting within the [[subduction|subducting]] Nazca plate or the overriding South America plate, unlike the 27 February earthquake, which occurred as [[thrust fault]]ing on the interface between the two plates. Later in 2010, University of Chile Seismologist Sergio Barrientos stated that the earthquake was produced inside the South American plate.{{cite journal|last=Barrientos |first=Sergio E. |date=10 November 2010 |title=Terremoto (M=8.8) del 27 de febrero de 2010 en Chile |journal=Revista de la Asociación Geológica Argentina |location=Argentina |volume=412-420 |issue=67 |page=9 |url=http://www.scielo.org.ar/pdf/raga/v67n3/v67n3a11.pdf |accessdate=4 June 2012 |language=Spanish |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/6Egg32OHz?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.scielo.org.ar%2Fpdf%2Fraga%2Fv67n3%2Fv67n3a11.pdf |archivedate=25 February 2013 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} While news media reported the earthquake as an aftershock of the [[2010 Chile earthquake|February earthquake in Chile]],{{cite news |url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/americas/2010/03/2010311152233248405.html |title=Americas – Chile president vows to rebuild |publisher=[[Al Jazeera]] |date=12 March 2010 |accessdate=2 September 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121010231712/http://www.aljazeera.com/news/americas/2010/03/2010311152233248405.html|archivedate=10 October 2012|deadurl=no}} a preliminary geological summary issued by the USGS considered it to be an independent earthquake,{{Cite web |url= http://earthquake.usgs.gov/earthquakes/recenteqsww/Quakes/us2010tsa6.php |title=Magnitude 6.9 – LIBERTADOR O'HIGGINS, CHILE |publisher=[[United States Geological Survey]] |date=11 March 2010 |accessdate=2 September 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130213071803/http://earthquake.usgs.gov/earthquakes/recenteqsww/Quakes/us2010tsa6.php|archivedate=13 February 2013|deadurl=no}} a conclusion which seismologist Jaime Campos of the [[University of Chile]] also reached.{{Cite web |url= http://www.ultimahora.cl/content/view/844899/SISMOLOGO-DE-LA-UNIVERSIDAD-DE-CHILE-ES-POSIBLE-OTRO-TERREMOTO.html |title=Sismólogo de la Universidad de Chile: "Es posible otro terremoto" |trans_title=University of Chile seismologist: "Another earthquake is possible" |publisher=Última Hora |date=23 June 2010 |accessdate=12 September 2010 |language=Spanish|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120314065815/http://www.ultimahora.cl/content/view/844899/SISMOLOGO-DE-LA-UNIVERSIDAD-DE-CHILE-ES-POSIBLE-OTRO-TERREMOTO.html|archivedate=14 March 2012|deadurl=no}}{{cite news|url=http://www.emol.com/noticias/nacional/2010/06/23/420693/sismologo-es-posible-que-ocurra-otro-terremoto-en-la-zona-afectada-por-megasismo-de-88-grados.html|title=Sismólogo: Es posible que ocurra otro terremoto en la zona afectada por megasismo de 8,8 grados|last=Ramírez|first=Natacha|date=23 June 2010|work=[[El Mercurio]]|publisher=[[COPESA]]|language=Spanish|accessdate=23 July 2011|location=Santiago, Chile|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121006022259/http://www.emol.com/noticias/nacional/2010/06/23/420693/sismologo-es-posible-que-ocurra-otro-terremoto-en-la-zona-afectada-por-megasismo-de-88-grados.html|archivedate=6 October 2012|deadurl=no}} [[File:Seismic Hazard Map 2010 Pichilemu Earthquake.jpg|thumb|Seismic hazard near the epicentre of the earthquake.]] The earthquake has been given three different locations: the University of Chile Seismological Service (''Servicio Sismológico de la Universidad de Chile'') stated that the event occurred {{convert|15|km|mi}} northwest of [[Pichilemu]], at a depth of {{convert|33.1|km|mi}};{{Cite web |url= http://sismologia.cl/events/sensibles/2010/03/20100311143929.html |title=Informe de Sismo. |trans_title=Earthquake Report. |publisher=Servicio Sismológico de la [[Universidad de Chile]] |date=11 March 2010 |language=Spanish |accessdate=2 September 2010 |deadurl=yes|archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/6EhoGmKAj|archivedate=15 July 2012}}{{cite news |title= El mayor fue de 7,2° Richter |trans_title=The strongest was of 7.2° Richter |publisher=Chile.com |date=11 March 2010 |language=Spanish |accessdate=2 September 2010 |url=http://www.chile.com/tpl/articulo/detalle/ver.tpl?cod_articulo=118476|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100315132704/http://www.chile.com/tpl/articulo/detalle/ver.tpl?cod_articulo=118476|archivedate=15 March 2010|deadurl=yes}}{{cite news |url=http://24horas.cl/videos.aspx?id=63158 |title=Réplica: Onemi sitúa epicentro en Pichilemu |trans_title=Aftershock: Onemi locates epicenter in Pichilemu |publisher=[[Televisión Nacional de Chile]]|work=24 Horas |date=11 March 2010 |accessdate=2 September 2010 |language=Spanish|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120227154457/http://24horas.cl/videos.aspx?id=63158|archivedate=27 February 2012|deadurl=no}} the United States Geological Service reported the earthquake occurred {{convert|105|km|mi}} west of [[Rancagua]], capital of [[O'Higgins Region]], at a depth of {{convert|11|km|mi}}; and local [[online newspaper]] ''[[Pichilemu News]]'' reported the earthquake occurred {{convert|35|km|mi}} northeast of Pichilemu, between the villages of [[Cardonal de Panilonco|Panilonco]] and [[La Aguada, Pichilemu|La Aguada]], and reached a moment magnitude of 7.2.{{cite news|url=http://www.pichilemunews.cl/20100312_TraspasoDeMando.html|title=¿Los primeros signos del cambio?: Movido cambio de mando se vivió en el país ante nuevas réplicas del terremoto|last=Saldías|first=Washington|authorlink=Washington Saldías González|date=11 March 2010|work=[[Pichilemu News]]|language=Spanish|accessdate=14 June 2011|location=Pichilemu, Chile|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100323150927/http://pichilemunews.blogcindario.com/2010/03/03325-los-primeros-signos-del-cambio-movido-cambio-de-mando-se-vivio-en-el-pais-ante-nuevas-replicas.html|archivedate=23 March 2010|deadurl=yes}} On 15 March 2010, seismologist Mario Pardo from the [[University of Chile]] Seismological Service ruled out that [[Pichilemu]] was experiencing a [[Earthquake swarm|seismic swarm]], after public concerns about the continued aftershocks in the area;{{Cite web |url= http://www.cooperativa.cl/experto-descarto-que-pichilemu-sea-un-enjambre-sismico-por-alta-cantidad-de-replicas/prontus_nots/2010-03-15/075938.html |title=Experto descartó que Pichilemu sea un enjambre sísmico por alta cantidad de réplicas |trans_title=Expert ruled out that Pichilemu is a seismic swarm due to high quantity of aftershocks |publisher=[[Radio Cooperativa]] |language=Spanish |date=15 March 2010 |accessdate=2 September 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121010113555/http://www.cooperativa.cl/experto-descarto-que-pichilemu-sea-un-enjambre-sismico-por-alta-cantidad-de-replicas/prontus_nots/2010-03-15/075938.html|archivedate=10 October 2012|deadurl=no}} as of that date, more than 50 aftershocks had occurred in the area, the strongest of them measuring 6.7 in the moment magnitude scale, minutes after the initial quake.{{Cite web |url= http://www.cooperativa.cl/unos-50-sismos-con-el-mismo-epicentro-han-sacudido-chile-desde-el-jueves/prontus_nots/2010-03-13/184956.html |title=Unos 50 sismos con el mismo epicentro han sacudido Chile desde el jueves |trans_title=About 50 tremors with the same epicenter have shaken Chile since Thursday |publisher=[[Radio Cooperativa]] |date=15 March 2010 |language=Spanish |accessdate=2 September 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121010113508/http://www.cooperativa.cl/unos-50-sismos-con-el-mismo-epicentro-han-sacudido-chile-desde-el-jueves/prontus_nots/2010-03-13/184956.html|archivedate=10 October 2012|deadurl=no}} From the pattern of aftershocks, it has been suggested that this earthquake originated from rupture along a previously unknown [[geological fault]], the [[Pichilemu Fault]], between Pichilemu and the commune of [[Vichuquén]] in [[Maule Region]], at 15 km depth, 40 km in length and 20 km wide.{{cite news|url=http://latercera.com/contenido/680_261687_9.shtml |title=Pichilemu tiene falla geológica que genera oleada de réplicas en esa zona |trans_title=Pichilemu has geological fault that generates wave of aftershocks in that area |last=Fernández |first=O. |date=22 May 2010 |publisher=[[La Tercera]] |language=Spanish |accessdate=30 October 2010 |location=Santiago, Chile |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/6EhoWiLCg?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.latercera.com%2Fcontenido%2F680_261687_9.shtml |archivedate=25 February 2013 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }}{{cite journal|last=Lange|first=D.|last2=Tilmann|first2=F.|last3=Barrientos|first3=S. E.|last4=Contreras-Reyes|first4=E.|last5=Methe|first5=P.|last6=Moreno|first6=M.|last7=Heit|first7=B.|last8=Agurto,|first8=H.|last9=Bernard,|first9=P.|last10=Vilotte|first10=J.-P.|last11=Beck|first11=S.|title=Aftershock Seismicity of the 27 February 2010 Mw 8.8 Maule Earthquake Rupture Zone,|date=January 2012| volume = 317-183 | doi = 10.1016/j.epsl.2011.11.034| journal = Earth and Planetary Science Letters | pages = 17|bibcode = 2012E&PSL.317..413L }} At first it was not known whether this fault was formed during the earthquake or if it was just reactivated,{{cite news|url=http://radio.uchile.cl/noticias/72407/ |title=Sismólogos advierten sobre la activación de fallas después del terremoto |trans_title=Seismologists warn about activation of faults after the earthquake |last=Correa |first=Paula |work=Radio Universidad de Chile |publisher=[[University of Chile|Universidad de Chile]] |language=Spanish |accessdate=30 October 2010 |location=Santiago, Chile |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/6EhoaekKx?url=http%3A%2F%2Fradio.uchile.cl%2Fnoticias%2F72407%2F |deadurl=no |archivedate=25 February 2013 |df=dmy }} however geologist José Cembrano from the University of Chile affirmed that "[the fault] corresponds to a long life fault, in a million years time, whose activity had not been detected before."{{Cite web|url=http://radiopolar.com/noticia_45169.html |title=Las cinco fallas geológicas más importantes que Chile debe tener en cuenta |publisher=Radio Polar |location=[[Punta Arenas, Chile|Punta Arenas]], Chile |date=20 April 2011 |language=Spanish |accessdate=23 April 2011 |trans_title=The five most important geological faults Chile has to take into account |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/6EhoddcPA?url=http%3A%2F%2Fradiopolar.com%2Fnoticia_45169.html |archivedate=25 February 2013 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} In a 2012 publication titled ''Aftershock Seismicity of the 27 February 2010 Mw 8.8 Maule Earthquake Rupture Zone'', it was stated that, in total, 10,000 [[aftershock]]s were located in the Pichilemu area for the first six months after the mainshock; this pronounced [[crust (geology)|crustal]] aftershock activity with mainly [[fault (geology)#Dip-slip faults|normal faulting mechanisms]] found in approximately a {{convert|30|km|mi}} wide region, with sharp inclined borders and oriented oblique to the [[trench]]. ==Reaction== [[File:Sebastián Piñera asume como Presidente de Chile en solemne ceremonia en el Congreso Nacional.jpg|thumb|The earthquake took place just minutes before [[President of Chile|President]] [[Sebastián Piñera]] was sworn in at the [[National Congress of Chile]].]] The earthquake took place minutes before the new [[President of Chile]], [[Sebastián Piñera]], was sworn in, at about {{Tooltip|12:15 local time|(15:15 UTC)}}, at the Chilean congress in [[Valparaíso]], where the shaking was clearly felt.{{Cite news|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2010/03/11/chile-pinera-idUSN1119348920100311 |title=Billionaire Pinera takes power as quakes jolt Chile |agency=[[Reuters]] |first=Javier |last=López |date=11 March 2010 |accessdate=5 September 2010 |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/6Ehoj2zBb?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.reuters.com%2Farticle%2F2010%2F03%2F11%2Fchile-pinera-idUSN1119348920100311 |archivedate=25 February 2013 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} Piñera was at the [[Palace of Cerro Castillo]] at the time of the earthquake, and as he left the place, he was seen "looking worried"; [[Michelle Bachelet]], the outgoing president, was also seen "worried" by the earthquake as she entered the Congress.{{cite news|url=http://www.lanacion.cl/replicas-movieron-ceremonia-en-que-asumio-pinera/noticias/2010-03-11/113518.html|title=Réplicas movieron ceremonia en que asumió Piñera|work=[[La Nación (Chile)|La Nación]]|publisher=Empresa Periodística La Nación|date=11 March 2010|language=Spanish|trans_title=Aftershocks shaked ceremony in which Piñera took office|deadurl=no|archivedate=17 March 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100317122613/http://www.lanacion.cl/replicas-movieron-ceremonia-en-que-asumio-pinera/noticias/2010-03-11/113518.html}} ''[[La Nación (Chile)|La Nación]]'' newspaper reported some journalists attempted to flee the Congress building. According to Spanish newspaper ''[[El Mundo (Spain)|El Mundo]]'', there was "nervousness" at the ceremony, and the ceremony narrator called for calm, adding that the Congress building could even stand stronger earthquakes.{{cite news|url=http://www.elmundo.es/america/2010/03/11/noticias/1268319255.html|title=Piñera asume la presidencia de Chile tras fuertes terremotos|trans_title=Piñera takes office as President of Chile after strong earthquakes|work=[[El Mundo (Spain)|El Mundo]]|last=Barreno|first=Jorge|date=11 March 2010|publisher=Unidad Editorial Internet, S.L.|accessdate=5 April 2014|archivedate=8 January 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140108081656/http://www.elmundo.es/america/2010/03/11/noticias/1268319255.html}}{{cite news|url=http://www.elmundo.es/america/2010/03/11/noticias/1268329345.html|title=Los sismos de hoy son 'típicos' y se esperan meses de réplicas|trans_title=Today's quakes are 'typical' and months of aftershocks are awaiting|work=[[El Mundo (Spain)|El Mundo]]|date=11 March 2010|publisher=Unidad Editorial Internet, S.L.|accessdate=5 April 2014|archivedate=8 January 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140108082510/http://www.elmundo.es/america/2010/03/11/noticias/1268329345.html}} [[File:Presidente Piñera en Rancagua tras terremoto de Pichilemu de 2010.jpg|thumb|left|President Piñera's visit to Rancagua on the earthquake day]] Presidents [[Néstor Kirchner]] of [[Argentina]], [[Evo Morales]] of Bolivia, [[Álvaro Uribe]] of [[Colombia]], [[Rafael Correa]] of Ecuador, and [[Fernando Lugo]] of [[Paraguay]] were present at the ceremony, but television footage showed that the inauguration was not interrupted, even though there was a [[tsunami warning]] in place;{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2010/WORLD/americas/03/11/chile.earthquake/index.html |title=Three strong earthquakes strike Chile in quick succession |publisher=[[CNN]] |date=11 March 2010 |accessdate=2 September 2010 |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/6EhoqSnd3?url=http%3A%2F%2Fedition.cnn.com%2F2010%2FWORLD%2Famericas%2F03%2F11%2Fchile.earthquake%2Findex.html |archivedate=25 February 2013 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} however, it was reported the ceremony was "speeded." President Piñera cancelled the ceremonial lunch with his visitors and traveled to [[Rancagua]], one of the cities most affected by the earthquake; Piñera subsequently declared a catastrophe state in O'Higgins Region as a result of the earthquake, and appointed Army General Antonio Yackcich as Area Commander in Chief (''Jefe de Plaza'') for the region, while he was visiting Rancagua that day.{{cite news |url=http://www.latercera.com/contenido/680_233129_9.shtml |publisher=[[La Tercera]] |title=Presidente descarta toque de queda en VI Región y nombra a nuevo director de Onemi |trans_title=President discards curfew in VI Region and names new director of Onemi |date=11 March 2010 |accessdate=2 September 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120321002541/http://www.tercera.com/contenido/680_233129_9.shtml|archivedate=21 March 2012|deadurl=no}}{{Cite news |url= http://www.elrancahuaso.cl/admin/render/noticia/22347 |title=Presidente Piñera decreta Estado de Catástrofe en la Región de O´higgins |trans_title=President Piñera decrees Catastrophe State in O'Higgins Region |publisher=El Rancahuaso |date=12 March 2010 |language=Spanish |accessdate=2 September 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120312161734/http://www.elrancahuaso.cl/admin/render/noticia/22347|archivedate=12 March 2012|deadurl=no}} The declaration meant that "the military would occupy the area to keep order and prevent the kind of looting that occurred in Concepción during the first two to three days after last month's quake", according to ''[[The New York Times]]''. ==Tsunami== [[File:2010 Pichilemu earthquake - tsunami travel time map.jpg|thumb|left|Travel time map of the tsunami triggered by the 11 March 2010 Pichilemu earthquake.]] [[File:Militaries in the La Cruz Hill.jpg|thumb|right|Army personnel at [[La Cruz Hill]], [[Pichilemu]], shortly after the earthquake occurred.]] A [[Pacific Ocean|Pacific]]-wide [[tsunami]] warning was not issued by the [[Pacific Tsunami Warning Center]], although the organization pointed out the possibility of local tsunamis within {{convert|100|km|mi}} of the [[epicentre]], roughly the area between [[La Serena, Chile|La Serena]] and [[Concepción, Chile|Concepción]].{{cite web |title = Tsunami information bulletin |url = http://www.prh.noaa.gov/ptwc/messages/pacific/2010/pacific.2010.03.11.145212.txt |publisher = [[Pacific Tsunami Warning Center]] |date = 11 March 2010 |accessdate=2 September 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100819101212/http://www.prh.noaa.gov/ptwc/messages/pacific/2010/pacific.2010.03.11.145212.txt| archivedate= 19 August 2010 | deadurl= no}} Half an hour after the earthquake, the [[Hydrographic and Oceanographic Service of the Chilean Navy|Hydrographic and Oceanographic Service]] of the [[Chilean Navy]] (''Servicio Hidrográfico y Oceanográfico de la Armada'', SHOA) issued a tsunami warning for the area between Coquimbo and Los Lagos regions, as a way of "keeping people protected" against the possible occurrence of new tsunamis.{{cite news|url=http://www.emol.com/noticias/nacional/2010/03/11/402896/shoa-declaro-alerta-de-tsunami-tras-fuerte-replica-de-69-grados-richter.html|title=SHOA declaró alerta de tsunami tras fuerte réplica de 6,9 grados Richter|trans_title=SHOA issues tsunami warning after strong 6.9° Richter aftershock|date=11 March 2010|publisher=[[El Mercurio]]|language=Spanish|accessdate=18 October 2010|location=Santiago, Chile|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121005005245/http://www.emol.com/noticias/nacional/2010/03/11/402896/shoa-declaro-alerta-de-tsunami-tras-fuerte-replica-de-69-grados-richter.html|archivedate=5 October 2012|deadurl=no}}{{cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2010/03/11/world/main6288962.shtml|title=Strong Aftershocks Jolt Chile Inauguration|date=11 March 2010|publisher=[[CBS News]]|accessdate=18 October 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121104054228/http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2010/03/11/world/main6288962.shtml|archivedate=4 November 2012|deadurl=no}} President Piñera urged coastal residents to move to higher ground in case of a tsunami. Following the [[tsunami warning system|tsunami alert]], thousands of residents of central Pichilemu fled to [[La Cruz Hill]], with some of them staying them for several days,{{cite news|url=http://www.lun.com/Pages/NewsDetail.aspx?dt=2010-03-12&NewsID=84245&BodyID=0&PaginaId=24 |title=En Pichilemu se fueron a la punta del cerro |last=García |first=Víctor |date=12 March 2010 |work=[[Las Últimas Noticias]] |publisher=Empresa El Mercurio S.A.P. |page=24 |language=Spanish |accessdate=4 June 2012 |location=[[Pichilemu]] |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/6EhpLLDg5?url=http%3A%2F%2Fimages.lun.com%2Flunservercontents%2FNewsPaperPages%2F2010%2Fmar%2F12%2FLUCST24LU1203_800.swf |archivedate=25 February 2013 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }}{{Cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.cl/pichilemu-durmio-en-cerros-por-temor-a-tsunami/noticias/2010-03-12/073734.html |title=Pichilemu durmió en cerros por temor a tsunami |trans_title=Pichilemu slept in hills due to fear to a tsunami |publisher=[[La Nación (Santiago)|La Nación]] |date=12 March 2010 |language=Spanish |accessdate=16 September 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120927013826/http://www.lanacion.cl/pichilemu-durmio-en-cerros-por-temor-a-tsunami/noticias/2010-03-12/073734.html|archivedate=27 September 2012|deadurl=no}} and received advice from members of the Army.{{cite news|url=http://www.pichilemunews.cl/index_Marzo_2010.html|title=Tres sismos con características de terremoto han afectado en menos de 20 minutos a la zona central del país|trans_title=Three tremors with characteristics of earthquake have affected in less than twenty minutes the central area of the country|last=Saldías|first=Washington|date=11 March 2010|publisher=[[Pichilemu News]]|language=Spanish|accessdate=18 October 2010|location=Pichilemu, Chile|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110707012314/http://www.pichilemunews.cl/index_Marzo_2010.html|archivedate=7 July 2011|deadurl=yes}} People from the village of [[Cáhuil]] stayed at Cordón. The tsunami warning emitted by SHOA was lifted that same day at around {{Tooltip|15:50 local time|(18:50 UTC)}}.{{cite news|url=http://www.terra.cl/actualidad/index.cfm?id_cat=302&id_reg=1378045|title=El SHOA levantó la alerta de tsunami en la costa continental|trans_title=SHOA lifts tsunami warning in continental coast|date=11 March 2010|publisher=[[Terra Chile]]|language=Spanish|accessdate=18 October 2010|location=Santiago, Chile|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120322053654/http://www.terra.cl/actualidad/index.cfm?id_cat=302&id_reg=1378045|archivedate=22 March 2012|deadurl=yes}} According to a preliminary report by the [[National Office of Emergency of the Interior Ministry]] (''Oficina Nacional de Emergencias del Ministerio del Interior'', ONEMI) on 11 March 2010, only 'small waves, without any [special] kind of characteristics' were seen in the area surrounding Pichilemu, while the USGS reported a small tsunami, with sea wave heights of 16 centimetres (0.525 ft) at [[Valparaíso]], and 29 centimetres (0.951 ft) at [[San Antonio, Chile|San Antonio]]. Interior Minister [[Rodrigo Hinzpeter]] reported violent waves in Pichilemu{{Cite web |url= http://mexico.cnn.com/mundo/2010/03/11/chile-levanta-la-alerta-de-tsunami-decretada-tras-el-sismo-de-69-grados |title=Chile levanta la alerta de tsunami decretada tras el sismo de 6.9 grados |trans_title=Chile lifts tsunami warning decreed after 6.9 grades seism |publisher=[[CNN|CNN México]] |date=11 March 2010 |language=Spanish |accessdate=1 October 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120510084829/http://mexico.cnn.com/mundo/2010/03/11/chile-levanta-la-alerta-de-tsunami-decretada-tras-el-sismo-de-69-grados|archivedate=10 May 2012|deadurl=no}} and Bucalemu.{{Cite web |url= http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2010/03/11/72-magnitude-quake-hits-c_n_494779.html |title=Chile Earthquake 11 March: 7.2-Magnitude Quake Hits Chile During Inauguration |publisher=[[The Huffington Post]] |date=11 March 2010 |last=Warren|first=Michael |accessdate=5 September 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121113133146/http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2010/03/11/72-magnitude-quake-hits-c_n_494779.html|archivedate=13 November 2012|deadurl=no}}{{cite news|quote=There were no reports of more deaths, but violent waves hit the coastal towns of Pichilemu and Bucalemu, Interior Minister Rodrigo Hinzpeter said.|title=Pinera works late, promises better dawn for Chile|publisher=[[Associated Press]]|last=Warren|first=Michael|date=12 March 2010|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1A1-D9ED049G0.html|accessdate=12 May 2013}} {{subscription needed}} ==Damage and casualties== [[File:People camping in La Cruz Hill.jpg|thumb|Locals set an improvised camp at the [[La Cruz Hill]] in Pichilemu, shortly after the tsunami warning was decreed]] [[File:Pichilemu post office demolition.jpg|thumb|left|The [[Pichilemu post-office building]] was severely damaged by the February and March earthquakes.]] At Pichilemu, the epicentre town, the earthquake destroyed the [[baluster|balustres]] surrounding [[Agustín Ross Park]], damaged severely the recently re-inaugurated [[Agustín Ross Cultural Centre]], and the [[Espinillo, Chile|Espinillo]], and [[Rodeillo]] villages.{{cite news |url=http://tele13.13.cl/noticias/reporteros/14100.htm |title=Pichilemu: entre los cerros y el mar |trans_title=Pichilemu: between the hills and the sea |publisher=[[Canal 13 (Chile)|Canal 13]] |date=16 March 2010 |language=Spanish |last=Hans|first=Jorge |accessdate=2 September 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318040744/http://tele13.13.cl/noticias/reporteros/14100.htm|archivedate=18 March 2012|deadurl=yes}}{{Cite web |url= http://tele13.13.cl/noticias/regiones/14088.htm |title=Espinillo: uno de los pueblos olvidados tras el terremoto |trans_title=Espinillo: one of the forgotten towns after the earthquake |work=Teletrece|publisher= [[Canal 13 (Chile)|Canal 13]] |language=Spanish |date=16 March 2010 |accessdate=7 September 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120304025937/http://tele13.13.cl/noticias/regiones/14088.htm|archivedate=4 March 2012|deadurl=yes}} The earthquake was accompanied by "great noise," according to witnesses from the Pichilemu villages of [[Cardonal de Panilonco]] and [[La Aguada, Pichilemu|La Aguada]]; most of the already damaged buildings in La Aguada fell down, including the local church. The road to Cardonal de Panilonco was damaged, and many houses built with [[adobe]] did not resist the shaking.{{cite news|url=http://www.lun.com/Pages/NewsDetail.aspx?dt=2010-03-12&NewsID=84245&BodyID=0&PaginaId=23 |title=Viaje al epicentro de una terrible réplica |last=García |first=Víctor |date=12 March 2010 |work=[[Las Últimas Noticias]] |publisher=[[COPESA]] |page=23 |language=Spanish |accessdate=4 June 2012 |location=[[Cardonal de Panilonco|Panilonco]], [[Pichilemu]] |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/6EhpH4233?url=http%3A%2F%2Fimages.lun.com%2Flunservercontents%2FNewsPaperPages%2F2010%2Fmar%2F12%2FLUCST23LU1203_800.swf |archivedate=25 February 2013 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} Outside Pichilemu, in [[Rancagua]], local mayor Eduardo Soto reported severe damage to homes in the town.{{Cite web |url= http://news.blogs.cnn.com/2010/03/11/breaking-strong-quake-reported-in-chile/ |title=Chile leader: 'Significant damage' in Rancagua |publisher=CNN |date=11 March 2010 |accessdate=5 September 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130115162818/http://news.blogs.cnn.com/2010/03/11/breaking-strong-quake-reported-in-chile/|archivedate=15 January 2013|deadurl=no}} The Santa Julia highway overpass located between [[Rancagua]] and [[Graneros]] collapsed, and part of the [[Pan-American highway]] was damaged. A power outage affected Pichilemu for two days, beginning right after the earthquake struck,{{cite news|url=http://diario.elmercurio.com/2010/03/12/nacional/_portada/noticias/8A2434C1-D813-408D-9C44-A2AE2C5C0B26.htm?id={8A2434C1-D813-408D-9C44-A2AE2C5C0B26} |title=Por temor a tsunami, habitantes de Pichilemu pasaron la noche en cerros |last=Ramos |first=Ariel |date=12 March 2012 |work=[[El Mercurio]] |publisher=[[COPESA]] |language=Spanish |accessdate=4 June 2012 |location=Vitacura, Chile |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/6EhzhAr7J?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdoc-00-60-docs.googleusercontent.com%2Fdocs%2Fsecuresc%2Fha0ro937gcuc7l7deffksulhg5h7mbp1%2Fm1qrd6quinrvlqq2qu15n2utn6s8qlau%2F1361836800000%2F03878218933758081009%2F%2A%2F0B0avc7X-1skec1gwQUUyNXBuNW8%3Fe%3Ddownload |archivedate=25 February 2013 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }} {{subscription needed}} and there were partial power outages in [[Mostazal]], [[San Fernando, Chile|San Fernando]] and [[Peumo]].{{Cite news |url= http://www.latercera.com/contenido/680_233054_9.shtml |title=Onemi: caída de pasarela, 'pequeño oleaje' y cortes de luz tras sismo |trans_title=Onemi: gateway fall, 'small waves' and power outages after tremor |publisher=[[La Tercera]] |language=Spanish |date=11 March 2010 |accessdate=2 September 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120321002553/http://www.tercera.com/contenido/680_233054_9.shtml|archivedate=21 March 2012|deadurl=no}} In [[Santiago, Chile|Santiago]], "windows rattled, buildings trembled and cellphone service failed", according to a ''[[The New York Times]]'' article. The old Basílica del Salvador in Santiago, which was damaged during the [[1985 Algarrobo earthquake]] and was never repaired, suffered additional damage.{{cite news|url=http://www.lun.com/Pages/NewsDetail.aspx?dt=2010-03-12&NewsID=84159&BodyID=0&PaginaId=33 |title=Un Cristo quedó colgando en basílica |last=Valenzuela |first=Óscar |date=12 March 2010 |work=[[Las Últimas Noticias]] |publisher=[[COPESA]] |language=Spanish |accessdate=5 June 2012 |location=Santiago, Chile |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/6EhsHU3Aw?url=http%3A%2F%2Fimages.lun.com%2Flunservercontents%2FNewsPaperPages%2F2010%2Fmar%2F12%2FLUCST33LU1203_800.swf |archivedate=25 February 2013 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} In Nilahue Barahona, a village near the town of [[Pumanque]], electric cables fell to the ground during the earthquake, causing a fire that burned {{convert|65|ha}} of a pine, eucalyptus and grassland forest.{{cite news|title=Réplicas del terremoto: caída de cables eléctricos originan incendio en la costa|work=Diario VI Región|page=9|date=13 March 2010|language=Spanish|quote=PUMANQUE.- Alrededor de 65 hectáreas de eucaliptus, pino y pastizales se quemaron debido a un incendio forestal registrado en las últimas horas en la zona costera de la Región de O'Higgins. (...)|location=San Fernando, Chile|publisher=Sociedad Periodística Portales Ltda.}} The earthquake was also reported to have been felt in [[Mendoza, Argentina|Mendoza]],{{Cite web |url= http://www.diariouno.com.ar/contenidos/2010/03/11/noticia_0024.html |title=Hubo 15 sismos en Chile y 5 se sintieron fuerte en Mendoza |trans_title=There were 15 seisms in Chile and 5 were felt strongly in Mendoza |publisher=Diario Uno |language=Spanish |date=11 March 2010 |accessdate=2 September 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318025735/http://www.diariouno.com.ar/contenidos/2010/03/11/noticia_0024.html|archivedate=18 March 2012|deadurl=no}} [[Bariloche]], [[Córdoba, Argentina|Córdoba]], [[San Rafael, Argentina|San Rafael]], Buenos Aires, [[Montevideo]], and [[Asunción]].{{Cite web |url= http://earthquake.usgs.gov/earthquakes/dyfi/events/us/2010tsa6/us/index.html |title=M6.9–Libertador O'higgins, Chile |publisher=[[United States Geological Survey]] |date=March 2010 |accessdate=2 September 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120326213834/http://earthquake.usgs.gov/earthquakes/dyfi/events/us/2010tsa6/us/index.html|archivedate=26 March 2012|deadurl=no}} One person died of a heart attack during the earthquake in [[Talca]], Maule Region.{{cite news |url=http://www.latercera.com/contenido/680_233172_9.shtml |title=Hombre fallece en Talca de un paro cardíaco en medio de fuertes réplicas |trans_title=Man dies in Talca of a heart attack amidst strong aftershocks |publisher=[[La Tercera]] |language=Spanish |date=11 March 2010 |accessdate=2 September 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120226042937/http://www.latercera.com/contenido/680_233172_9.shtml|archivedate=26 February 2012|deadurl=no}} A [[United States Geological Survey]] summary of the earthquake reported damage at [[Rancagua]], 177 kilometers northeast of Pichilemu.{{cite news|url=http://www.elrancahuaso.cl/admin/render/noticia/13092|title=Rancahuasos de Vacaciones Hoy: Pichilemu|trans_title=Rancahuasos in Vacations Today: Pichilemu|last=Rey|first=Cynthia|date=12 February 2008|publisher=El Rancahuaso|language=Spanish|accessdate=18 October 2010|location=Rancagua, Chile| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20101016093435/http://www.elrancahuaso.cl/admin/render/noticia/13092| archivedate= 16 October 2010 | deadurl= no}} Relief efforts for the 27 February earthquake stalled for about six hours because of the constant aftershocks. According to the U.S. [[National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration]]'s [[National Geophysical Data Center]], the damage provoked by the earthquake and its accompanying small tsunami was "limited", adding that "a rough estimate of the [[US dollar|dollar]] amount of damage" was "roughly corresponding to less than one million".{{cite web|url=http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/nndc/struts/results?EQ_0=4722&t=101650&s=8&d=22,26,13,12&nd=display|title=Significant Earthquake (Chile: Rancagua)|work=[[National Geophysical Data Center]]|publisher=[[National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration]]|date=11 March 2010|accessdate=5 April 2014|deadurl=no|archivedate=5 April 2014|archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/6Oc2GWclz}} ==Aftershocks== [[File:House in Pichilemu, Chile, after 2010 earthquake.jpg|thumb|Several buildings in Pichilemu were damaged after the earthquake and its aftershocks.]] Following the main shock, there were two aftershocks of magnitude 6 or greater. The first of them occurred at {{Tooltip|11:55 local time|(14:55 UTC)}}, fifteen minutes after the initial quake, and was centered in the commune of [[La Estrella, Chile|La Estrella]], [[Cardenal Caro Province]], at a depth of {{convert|18.0|km|mi}}, reaching a magnitude of 6.7; another aftershock, of magnitude 6.0, took place eleven minutes later, at {{Tooltip|12:06 local time|(15:06 UTC)}}, this time centered in Pichilemu, at a depth of {{convert|29.3|km|mi}}.{{Cite web |url= http://earthquake.usgs.gov/earthquakes/eqarchives/significant/sig_2010.php |title=Significant Earthquakes of the World |publisher=[[United States Geological Survey]] |year=2010 |accessdate=6 September 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121013072817/http://earthquake.usgs.gov/earthquakes/eqarchives/significant/sig_2010.php|archivedate=13 October 2012|deadurl=no}} In total, there were ten aftershocks within the six hours after the 6.9 magnitude earthquake, two of magnitude 6 or greater, and seven between 5 and 6.{{cite news |publisher=[[La Nación (Santiago)|La Nación]] |url=http://www.lanacion.cl/fuertes-replicas-y-alerta-de-tsunami-en-la-zona-centro-sur/noticias/2010-03-11/114113.html |title=Fuertes réplicas y alerta de tsunami en la zona centro-sur |trans_title=Strong aftershocks and tsunami warning in central-southern zone |date=11 March 2010 |accessdate=29 April 2010 |language=Spanish| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100325050854/http://lanacion.cl/fuertes-replicas-y-alerta-de-tsunami-en-la-zona-centro-sur/noticias/2010-03-11/114113.html| archivedate= 25 March 2010 | deadurl= no}} Almost two months later, on 2 May 2010, an aftershock of magnitude 5.8 [[Moment magnitude scale|MW]] struck the Chilean [[O'Higgins Region]], at {{Tooltip|10:52 local time|(14:52 UTC)}}. The aftershock was centered {{convert|44|km|mi|0}} southwest of [[Navidad, Chile|Navidad]], and occurred at a depth of {{convert|32.9|km|mi|0}}, according to the University of Chile Seismological Service.{{Cite web|url=http://www.sismologia.cl/events/sensibles/2010/05/02-1452-40L.S201005.html |title=Informe de sismo sensible |trans_title=Report of sensible earthquake |publisher=Servicio Sismológico de la [[Universidad de Chile]] |accessdate=25 February 2013 |language=Spanish |date=2 May 2010 |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/6EhsMOvKO?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.sismologia.cl%2Fevents%2Fsensibles%2F2010%2F05%2F02-1452-40L.S201005.html |archivedate=25 February 2013 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} The National Emergencies Office (ONEMI) reported that the aftershock was felt most strongly in [[Talca]], {{convert|258|km|mi}} south of Santiago, and that there were no casualties, only some telephone lines had collapsed.{{Cite news |url= http://www.elnuevodia.com/sismode5.9gradosenchile-696989.html |title=Sismo de 5.9 grados en Chile |trans_title=5.9 grades seism in Chile |publisher=El Nuevo Día |language=Spanish |accessdate=2 September 2010 |date=2 May 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120921032416/http://www.elnuevodia.com/sismode5.9gradosenchile-696989.html|archivedate=21 September 2012|deadurl=no}} Six other aftershocks subsequently hit the Pichilemu area that day.{{Cite news |url= http://www.latercera.com/contenido/680_256231_9.shtml |title=Seis sismos se han percibido este domingo en el sector de Pichilemu |trans_title=Five seisms have been perceived this Sunday in the Pichilemu area |publisher=[[La Tercera]] |date=2 May 2010 |language=Spanish |accessdate=2 September 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120321002609/http://www.tercera.com/contenido/680_256231_9.shtml|archivedate=21 March 2012|deadurl=no}} The United States Geological Survey measured the aftershock with a magnitude of 5.9.{{cite web |url= http://earthquake.usgs.gov/earthquakes/shakemap/global/shake/2010vubl/ |title=Shakemap us2010vubl |publisher=[[United States Geological Survey]] |date=2 May 2010|accessdate=15 July 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121016232800/http://earthquake.usgs.gov/earthquakes/shakemap/global/shake/2010vubl/|archivedate=16 October 2012|deadurl=no}} A further aftershock of the Pichilemu earthquake occurred on 29 September 2010 at {{Tooltip|12:29 local time|(16:29 UTC)}}.{{Cite web |url= http://www.onemi.cl/html/noticias/noticia_1260.html |title=Sismo de mediana intensidad entre regiones de Valparaíso y Maule |trans_title=Medium intensity seism between Valparaíso and Maule regions |publisher=[[ONEMI|National Emergencies Office of Chile]] |date=29 September 2010 |accessdate=2 October 2010 |language=Spanish|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111002114637/http://www.onemi.cl/html/noticias/noticia_1260.html|archivedate=2 October 2011|deadurl=no}} It reached [[Richter magnitude scale|magnitude]] 5.6, and its epicentre was centered {{convert|13|km|mi}} southwest of [[Lolol]], {{convert|43|km|mi}} southwest of [[Santa Cruz, Chile|Santa Cruz]],{{Cite web|url=http://www.sismologia.cl/events/sensibles/2010/09/29-1629-53L.S201009.html |trans_title=Report of sensible earthquake |title=Informe de sismo sensible |publisher=[[University of Chile]] Seismological Service (Servicio de Sismología de la Universidad de Chile) |date=2 September 2010 |accessdate=25 February 2013 |language=Spanish |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/6Ehsla5k0?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.sismologia.cl%2Fevents%2Fsensibles%2F2010%2F09%2F29-1629-53L.S201009.html |archivedate=25 February 2013 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }}{{Cite news |url= http://www.bbc.co.uk/mundo/ultimas_noticias/2010/09/100929_ultnot_chile_servicio_sismologico.shtml |title=Chile: el sismo fue de 5,9 grados |trans_title=Chile: seism was of 5.9 grades |publisher=BBC News |accessdate=2 October 2010 |date=29 September 2010 | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20101002094417/http://www.bbc.co.uk/mundo/ultimas_noticias/2010/09/100929_ultnot_chile_servicio_sismologico.shtml| archivedate= 2 October 2010 | deadurl= no|language=Spanish}} at a depth of {{convert|50|km|mi}}. Telephone lines collapsed in [[O'Higgins Region]]. No infrastructural damage or casualties was reported. The aftershock was felt between the [[Valparaíso Region|Valparaíso]] and [[Maule Region|Maule]] regions. The event reached [[Mercalli intensity scale|Mercalli]] V intensity in [[Rancagua]], [[Navidad, Chile|Navidad]], [[Talca]], [[Curicó]], amid other cities and towns. As of February 2013, there have been about 8,500 aftershocks of the Chilean February and March 2010 earthquakes according to the University of Chile Seismological Service, with most taking place in the proximities of Pichilemu. Seismologist Sergio Ruiz said that "a significant number of aftershocks" will take place at least until 2015.{{cite news|url=http://www.lanacion.cl/terremoto-del-27-f-ha-tenido-8-500-replicas-en-chile/noticias/2013-02-23/132652.html |title=Terremoto del 27/F ha tenido 8.500 réplicas en Chile |work=[[La Nación (Chile)|La Nación]] |publisher=Empresa Periodistica La Nación S.A. |date=23 February 2013 |accessdate=25 February 2013 |language=Spanish |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/6EhuEHOdl?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.lanacion.cl%2Fterremoto-del-27-f-ha-tenido-8-500-replicas-en-chile%2Fnoticias%2F2013-02-23%2F132652.html |archivedate=25 February 2013 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} ==Media coverage== [[File:El Mercurio on Pichilemu earthquake.jpg|thumb|One of the headlines of nationally-distributed newspaper ''[[El Mercurio]]'' of 12 March 2010 was about the Pichilemu earthquake, along with the oath ceremony of President Piñera on the day before.]] The earthquake was reported by local, national and international news media. Locally, online newspaper ''[[Pichilemu News]]'' published an article named "First signs of change?: Shaken handover ceremony in Chile because of new earthquake aftershocks" ("¿Los primeros signos del cambio?: Movido cambio de mando se vivió en el país ante nuevas réplicas del terremoto") on 11 March; five days later, local newspaper ''[[El Expreso de la Costa]]'' published an interview with Mario Pardo, seismologist in charge of the geophysics department of the [[University of Chile]], who recommended people of Pichilemu to "try to remain calm, the worst already happened".{{cite news|title=Máximo experto en terremotos en Chile envía mensaje a los pichileminos: "Traten de mantener la calma, lo peor ya pasó"|work=[[El Expreso de la Costa]]|last=Calderón|first=Félix|date=15 March 2010|location=Pichilemu, Chile|page=3|trans_title=Greatest expert in Chilean earthquakes sends message to people of Pichilemu: "Try to remain calm, the worst already happened"|language=Spanish}} The only local radio that continued broadcasting through the day of the earthquake was ''[[Radio Entre Olas]]'', directed by Jorge Nasser Guerra, who along with two other radio workers, reportedly were the only not to be evacuated after the earthquake in Pichilemu. Because the earthquake provoked a power outage, the radio worked with "emergency equipment".{{cite news|title=Habitantes de Pichilemu y alrededores fueron evacuados de sus casas|work=Rengo al día|location=Rengo, Chile|date=11 March 2010|language=Spanish|trans_title=Residents of Pichilemu and neighboring areas were evacuated from their homes|accessdate=6 April 2014|deadurl=no|archivedate=6 April 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140406191205/http://www.rengoaldia.cl/la-comuna/833-habitantes-de-pichilemu-y-alrrededores-fueron-evacuados-de-sus-casas|url=http://www.rengoaldia.cl/la-comuna/833-habitantes-de-pichilemu-y-alrrededores-fueron-evacuados-de-sus-casas}} Previously, after the 27 February earthquake, ''Entre Olas'' did not stop broadcasting either, despite there was a power outage that lasted for several days.{{cite news|title=Entreolas FM 93.1, la SUPER-RADIO que hizo frente al terremoto: dulce compañía, de noche y de día|work=[[El Expreso de la Costa]]|first=Félix|last=Calderón|date=15 March 2010|language=Spanish|location=Pichilemu, Chile|page=4|trans_title=Entreolas FM 93.1, the super radio who stood up and faced the earthquake: sweet company, through the day and night}} Nationally-distributed newspaper ''[[El Mercurio]]'' published on its 12 March 2010 main page the headline "6.9 [magnitude] aftershock marks the most seismic day after the [[2010 Chile earthquake|earthquake]]" ("Réplica de 6,9° marca el día más sísmico post terremoto"), adding that "[s]eventeen of the twenty seisms that occurred yesterday [11 March] in central-southern Chile had their epicentre in [[Pichilemu]], [[Region of O'Higgins]], which was declared in Disaster State yesterday."{{cite news|title=Réplica de 6,9° marca el día más sísmico post terremoto|work=[[El Mercurio]]|publisher=Empresa El Mercurio S.A.P.|date=12 March 2010|page=A1, C1-C27|language=Spanish|location=Vitacura, Chile|trans_title=6.9 magnitude aftershock marks the most seismic day after the earthquake}} On that same day, [[Santiago de Chile|Santiago]]-based newspaper ''[[La Tercera]]'' published on their headline: "Piñera faces first crisis as he takes office as new President" ("Piñera enfrenta primera crisis al asumir como nuevo Presidente"); ''La Tercera'' ellaborated: "The 6.9 Richter magnitude earthquake, which occurred minutes before the power handover took place, added an additional quota of drama to the oath of Sebastián Piñera, whose agenda was already modified by the 27 February disaster."{{cite news|title=Piñera enfrenta primera crisis al asumir como nuevo Presidente|publisher=[[COPESA]]|work=[[La Tercera]]|date=12 March 2010|language=Spanish|trans_title=Piñera faces first crisis as he takes office as new President|page=1|location=Santiago, Chile}} Other newspapers of national distribution where the earthquake was reported on its main page included ''[[Las Últimas Noticias]]'' (which featured a photograph of President Piñera aboarding a helicopter in military dress),{{cite news|title=El movido despegue del Presidente Piñera|work=[[Las Últimas Noticias]]|publisher=Empresa El Mercurio S.A.P.|date=12 March 2010|pages=1–18|language=Spanish|location=Vitacura, Chile|trans_title=The shakey takeoff of President Nación]]|publisher=Empresa Periodística La Nación S.A.|date=12 March 2010|location=Santiago, Chile|language=Spanish|pages=1–2|trans_title=Emergency measures mark start of Piñera}} [[File:New York photograph of presidents [[Fernando Lugo|Lugo]] and [[Rafael Correa|Correa]] during the earthquake.]] Throughout Chile, regional newspapers also reported the earthquake and tsunami warning on their edition of 12 March 2010.
